meanings.definition: To go along with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She accompanied her friend to the store.
meanings.sent2: The music was accompanied by a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella accompanied the rain, always by its side.
meanings.sent4: Laughter accompanied their journey, echoing through the hills.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds accompanied the sunrise, creating a symphony of nature.

meanings.definition: To be present or occur at the same time as something else.
meanings.sent2: A sense of excitement always accompanied the arrival of the circus.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accompanied the chaos, adding to the commotion.
meanings.sent4: An air of mystery accompanied the old mansion, shrouding it in secrets.
meanings.sent5: Hope accompanied the new year, promising fresh beginnings.
